issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
In KS, on the Base UI>Views>Coverflow view>Coverflow Local Files test, scrolling to the far right side of the stack of images then switching tabs and returning results in rendering problems. In addition to the imediately visible rendering issue, there may be a an image partially rendered behind the center image that is visible as you scroll through the images. This image goes away as you scroll by the same image in the stack.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KS built with SDK 1.8.0.1
2) Navigate to Base UI>Views>Coverflow view>Coverflow Local Files
3) Scroll to the far right of the stack
4) Switch tab
5) Switch back to the base UI tab

Result:
Image stack not as you left it with additional rendering problems as you manipulate the stack

Expected:
Images as you left them, no additional rendering issues

Note:
This also occurs on KS and SDK 1.7.5
fields.summary: iOS: CoverFlowView - Coverflow view rendering and functional issues when leaving and returning to tab

comments.body: Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
